message.content:
Forget all previous instructions.

You are an expert in following instructions. You are also an expert on various topics, especially on socio-economic development. You know how to read and understand sentences, and based from these sentences generate similar looking sentences but on different topics.

You will generate sentences indicating the use of a dataset and complementary datasets. Always mention specific datasets in the sentence.

You always return your response in JSON format that can be loaded in Python using `json.loads`. The format looks like:  [{"sentence": <sentence>, "dataset": [<dataset>], "topic": [<topic>]}]

Use topic only from this list separated by !!!!!: Agriculture and Food!!!!!Climate Change!!!!!Competitiveness!!!!!Debt!!!!!Digital Development!!!!!Disaster Risk Management !!!!!Education!!!!!Energy!!!!!Environment !!!!!Extractive Industries!!!!!Financial Inclusion!!!!!Financial Sector!!!!!Fragility, Conflict, and Violence!!!!!Gender!!!!!Governance!!!!!Health!!!!!Inequality and Shared Prosperity!!!!!Infrastructure!!!!!Jobs & Development!!!!!Macroeconomics!!!!!Migration!!!!!Nutrition!!!!!Poverty!!!!!Public-Private Partnerships!!!!!Regional Integration!!!!!Social Protection!!!!!Social Sustainability and Inclusion!!!!!Trade!!!!!Transport!!!!!Urban Development!!!!!Water

Generate 10 sentences on various topics that use datasets. The sentence lengths must have large variation with each other.

Consider generating complex sentence structure. Also generate sentences where multiple datasets are mentioned. Try to generate challenging and somewhat ambiguous sentences.

Example output: [{"sentence": "This study draws on data from the DHS conducted in Sub-Saharan African countries with at least two rounds of data.", "dataset": ["DHS"], "topic": ["Health"]}, {"sentence": "This paper uses administrative data on electricity billing records from Ghana and Rwanda.", "dataset": ["administrative data on electricity billing records"], "topic": ["Energy"]}, {"sentence": "We complement the electricity data with monthly data on temperature and total precipitation from the Copernicus Climate Change Service.", "dataset": ["Copernicus Climate Change Service"], "topic": ["Energy", "Climate Change"]}, {"sentence": "We use two main sources of data, both of which are novel: a dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18 and a time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports.", "dataset": ["dataset on the universe of Indonesian exporters in the period 2014-18", "time-varying dataset of NTMs applied on Indonesian imports"], "topic": ["Trade"]}, {"sentence": "To this end, we used multi-modal imaging and neuropsychological battery data available in the Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI) to investigate the relationship between cross-sectional measures of tau, cortical thickness, and different aspects of cognition.", "dataset": ["Alzheimer's Disease Neuroimaging Initiative (ADNI)"], "topic": ["Health"]}]

You will use the seed to always generate reproducible set of output, seed = 42.

[{"sentence": "Using data from the World Bank's Enterprise Surveys, we examine the relationship between access to finance and firm-level innovation in low- and middle-income countries.", "dataset": ["World Bank's Enterprise Surveys"], "topic": ["Financial Sector", "Jobs & Development"]}, {"sentence": "We analyze data from the Early Childhood Longitudinal Study to investigate whether early exposure to language, as measured by parent-reported â€œreads to childâ€ activities, impacts cognitive and non-cognitive skills among children over time.", "dataset": ["Early Childhood Longitudinal Study"], "topic": ["Education", "Child Development"]}, {"sentence": "We use panel data from the Living Standards Measurement Survey collected in Tanzania to examine the impacts of nutrition interventions on child growth and morbidity outcomes.", "dataset": ["Living Standards Measurement Survey"], "topic": ["Nutrition"]}, {"sentence": "This study employs a mixed-methods approach using qualitative and quantitative data from the World Values Survey and Afrobarometer to examine the relationship between intra-state conflict, collective action, and perceived corruption.", "dataset": ["World Values Survey", "Afrobarometer"], "topic": ["Governance", "Fragility, Conflict, and Violence"]}, {"sentence": "We draw on publicly available data from National Statistical Offices of 27 countries in sub-Saharan Africa to assess the quality of population-based survey data with respect to the computation of indicators of poverty levels.", "dataset": ["National Statistical Offices"], "topic": ["Poverty", "Data Quality"]}, {"sentence": "This report presents insights based on the analysis of Global Findex data and draws upon existing evidence on strategies used to overcome barriers and achieve greater financial inclusion.", "dataset": ["Global Findex"], "topic": ["Financial Inclusion"]}, {"sentence": "Using climate modelling data from CMIP6, we assess the potential impact of climate change on economic output in Sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["CMIP6"], "topic": ["Climate Change", "Macroeconomics"]}, {"sentence": "We combine nightlight data from the Suomi National Polar-Orbiting Partnership satellite and high-resolution satellite imagery to analyze the spatial distribution of population in sub-Saharan Africa with important implications for urbanization planning.", "dataset": ["nightlight data from the Suomi National Polar-Orbiting Partnership satellite", "high-resolution satellite imagery"], "topic": ["Urban Development", "Energy"]}, {"sentence": "This analysis uses water point mapping and household survey data to assess the benefits of public-private partnerships in expanding access to water services in rural areas of sub-Saharan Africa.", "dataset": ["water point mapping", "household survey data"], "topic": ["Water", "Public-Private Partnerships"]}, {"sentence": "Using a combination of observational and survey data, we investigate the relationship between exposure to air pollution and respiratory health outcomes in urban areas of Southeast Asia.", "dataset": ["observational data", "survey data"], "topic": ["Environment", "Health"]}]
